lexUnit.name: smell.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: perceive or detect the odour of something by the faculty of smell.

sentence.text: Sometimes I smell that odour as a perfume on women , like sweet Harpic .
When he got home that evening he could smell that Val was in a mood .
" I 've never smelt that in my life , " said Hazel with a touch of irritation .
Agrippa leaned closer and I smelt that strange perfume he always wore .
Moments alone were limited to climbing his tenement stairs , smelling different cooking smells on each landing .
You 're sometimes so busy looking at the wood that you do n't smell the trees are rotten . "
Simply to smell Coca-Cola made her , she said , violently sick .
` Bring us tea -- a pot of tea , and was that a sponge I smelt cooking earlier ?
The infant learns to talk of hearing its mother in the garden , smelling hamburgers cooking in the kitchen , or seeing the dog enjoying itself with a ball or being hurt by the cat .
He breathed deeply with his eyes shut and I smelt a baked saltiness coming from his jeans and was reminded of Franky .
I was half-dozing when suddenly I smelt something burning , followed by a small bang under my bed which shook me awake .
He knew this man , not by name or reputation , but by smelling the rotten evil about him .

Throughout their journey they had felt little of the uneasy fear that smells danger behind every bush but despite the weariness that dulled their senses these half-seen forms of rock among the trees seemed now to imply a threatening human presence .

Sure enough , when they had dammed the lake and poured in all the wine and brandy from the barrels , hundreds of elephants came hasting through the mountains , having smelt the liquor from many miles away .
At this point , the Scottish sister entered at speed -- she had probably smelt the champagne from several wards away .
He smelt the warm air from the moor , and watched the little white clouds in the blue sky .
But Arnold Thomas smelled a bigger profit from the up-and-coming developers who were looking to build back-to-backs for the mill-workers .
It smells the exudates from your body : blood , sweat , filth … ”
He would clearly hate to be patronized ; he would smell patronage in any apology , in any request for help made out of desire to soothe sore feelings .
He smelt smoke in her hair , felt her flesh soft under her shawl , and then a further quake in the crowd parted them .
He smelled the burning in the air , saw the stars dimmed by smoke above him .
Smelling the fresh dust in the air he realised that the load of grain in the hopper had only recently been discharged into the stall .
Libby smelt sickness in the brown canvas walls .
Other countries will smell British self-interest in these directives , and not just because Sir Leon Brittan is the commissioner who dreamed them up .
And I 've smelt Guinness off you , too . "
Smell the whisky on him ? "
I smell the windy world on his cheeks and hug him .
I thought oh my God , my God , my God he 's gon na smell it on me .
She smelled the wine on Paul 's breath , and bade him sit down .
Andrew added : ` She smelled smoke through the letterbox and naturally panicked and started banging on the door and shouting .
Passengers smell the scented Welsh air through the windows of four coaches … all of which have bodies designed and built at Henllan by Society member John Eden .
The scare began just after 5am when someone smelt acid as a freight train pulled into the station .
Vi smelled the desolation before she saw it : a mingling of dust and rubble and burning , water-doused timber .
` Have you ever smelled anything like it before ? " she said .
Then she saw a thin trail of smoke rising from her sister 's clothing , and smelt the dry odour of smouldering cloth .
` I think I smell them from here . "
I fancy sometimes that I can still smell stale tobacco-smoke in here , the place is impregnated with it .
The voice belched and the petrified Henry smelt beer .
I smell the blood of an Englishman .
She smelled strange scents , and saw ` with her bodily eyes " small white things , as thick as specks in a sunbeam , which appeared at night as well as in the daytime .
` I smelled the whisky . "
` I smell flowers too . "
Later he was with Becky when he smelled smoke and burning .
It was candles Gaily smelled now , the thick , snuffed-out smell of candle-smoke .
